result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawntrell K Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawntrell K Lee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Shawntrell K Lee.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel provides an update to the court and requests an additional status conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Status conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawntrell K Lee not in court, in custody.  Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court for Shawntrell K Lee.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Andrew T Gawronski in court, defendant Shawntrell K Lee not in court, in custody.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense acknowledges receipt of offer but no discovery.  State will provide discovery to Defense.  Court scheduled a status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shawntrell K Lee in court with Attorney Andrew T Gawronski.  Defendant Shawntrell K Lee in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. 
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 067187,
Payable Number: 1020279,
Receipt Number: 22RP028853,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shawntrell K Lee in court with attorney Andrew T Gawronski.  Defendant Shawntrell K Lee in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.   Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT RETAIN PRIVATE COUNSEL.  
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
